III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
1

rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/2/25, there was a physical altercation between youth that
resulted in one youth's thumb being bitten. On 5/3/25, the same
youth was in another fight with youth on the campus.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 7, 2025,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said on
May 2, 2025, she was in the gym sitting by Staff 2 who was
showing her an activity calendar on her phone. Youth A said
Youth B was also in the gym and began to “get in my business”
and made comments about Staff 2 allowing Youth A to be on her
phone. Youth A said she told Youth B to “mind her own business”
and Youth B “walked up” on her and they began to physically fight.
Youth A said Youth C “jumped in” and they both were fighting
Youth B. Youth A said during the fight she got her thumb bit by
Youth B. Youth A said there were about four or five staff that
intervened however only knew the names of Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Staff 4. Youth A said these staff were stopping the youth from
fighting. Youth A said she could not remember all the staff present
at the time. Youth A said after the staff separated the youth, she
saw Nurse who offered her ice and ibuprofen however she
refused, stating Nurse “annoyed her”. Youth A said she did not
have any marks or bruises from the incident. Youth A denied
being involved in any fight on May 3, 2025.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said on
May 2, 2025, she was in the gym talking with another youth when
she saw Youth A on Staff 2’s phone. Youth B said she made a
comment about youth not being allowed on staff’s phone which
made Youth A upset. Youth B said Youth A said, “why ya’ll getting
in my business” and then began to physically fight with her. Youth
B said during the altercation Youth C “jumped in” and was also
fighting her. Youth B said Youth A and Youth C hit her multiple
times, kicked her in the head, and stomped her head. Youth B
said there were “a lot of staff” present however only Staff 4 and
Staff 5 were intervening. Youth B said once the staff separated the
youth she was able to see a facility nurse and was given
ibuprofen.
2

Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 7,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C said on
May 2, 2025, she was in the gym with some other youth when
Youth B started “getting into a conversation that had nothing to do
with her”. Youth C said Youth A was sitting with Staff 2 and
looking at the activity calendar on her phone when Youth B started
making comments about Youth A. Youth C said Youth A told
Youth B to “mind her own business” but she kept talking. Youth C
said Youth B then walked down the bleachers towards Youth A
and they began to fight. Youth C said Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4, and
Staff 5 were telling the youth to stop and physically intervened.
Youth C said she then jumped in to help Youth A beat Youth B up.
Youth C said staff did all they could to stop the incident and never
allow any youth to fight. Youth C denied being injured and said
she is not aware of either of the other youth being injured during
the altercation.
Staff 1 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said on May 2, 2025,
she was in the gym with several youths for basketball. Staff 1 said
Youth A was sitting with Staff 2 at the bottom of the bleachers and
Youth B was sitting on the top of the bleachers with another youth.
Staff 1 said Youth A and Youth B began to argue because Youth
B was interjecting into Youth A’s conversation with Staff 2. Staff 1
said Youth B ran down the bleachers and began to fight Youth A.
Staff 1 said staff verbally directed the youth to stop and physically
separated them. Staff 1 said Youth A and Youth B continued to try
to get to one another and Youth C joined in the altercation. Staff 1
said Staff 3 and Staff 6 were called for assistance and were able
to help separate and remove the youth from the gym. Staff 1 said
she is aware of a staff member being hurt but otherwise is not
aware of any youth injuries.
Staff 2 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said she was in the
gym with youth on May 2, 2025. Staff 2 said she was sitting on the
bottom of the bleachers with Staff 4 and Youth A. Staff 2 said the
staff was showing Youth A the activity youth’s calendar which was
on her phone. Staff 2 said Youth B was at the top of the bleachers
and were interjecting in the conversation, making statements
about Youth A not being allowed to look at the staff’s phone. Staff
2 said Youth A told Youth B to stop making comments and “mind
her own business”. Staff 2 said Youth B asked Youth A if she
wanted to fight, to which Youth A responded she was not scared
of her. Staff 2 said Youth B then ran down the bleachers and
3

began to fight Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth C came out of the
bathroom at the same time and saw Youth A and Youth B fighting
and jumped in to help Youth A. Staff 2 said Staff 1, Staff 5, Staff 3
and Staff 6 were present and intervening in the incident and two
additional staff were called to assist. Staff 2 said the staff were
able to stop the altercation and remove the youth from the gym
back to their own units. Staff 2 said a staff was injured in her leg
and Youth B had some injury on her lip and side of her head. Staff
2 said staff responded appropriately to the situation.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on May 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor said he was
called to the gym for assistance on May 2, 2025, and when he
arrived the fight was already ended. Supervisor said he
remembered Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 6 all
being present in the gym with the youth upon his arrival.
Supervisor said he walked Youth A back to her unit and then went
back to his unit. Supervisor said Youth A was not injured to his
knowledge. Supervisor denied Youth A telling him that the staff
were allowing the fight or not intervening. Supervisor said that he
has not seen or heard of any staff ever allowing youth to fight at
the facility.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of May 2, 2025, gymnasium, was reviewed on
May 7, 2025. Youth A is seen sitting at the bottom of the
bleachers with other youth and staff. Youth B is seen sitting at the
top of the bleachers with another youth. The youth and staff at the
bottom of the bleachers are seen turning and looking up to where
Youth B is sitting. Youth B then stands up and pushes her shirt
sleeves up and runs down the bleachers. The group of staff and
youth at the bottom of the bleachers are seen getting up and
moving off the bleachers. Youth B runs over to Youth A and Staff
1 attempts to stand in front of Youth B and stop her from getting to
Youth A, however she was able to push past Staff 1 and begins to
fight with Youth A. Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 6
intervene and are standing in-between Youth A and Youth B and
trying to move them away from each other as they are moving
around the gym and Youth C also joins the altercation. The staff
are able to successfully separate the youth after 16 seconds by
getting in between them and walking them to opposite sides of the
gym.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated May 2, 2025, regarding the physical
altercation between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. The
4

incident report is consistent with staff and youth’s
interviews.
• Vista Maria Nursing Note dated May 2, 2025, for Youth A
was reviewed. The note states “Received a call from Rose
[Hall] stating a youth was in an altercation and had gotten
bitten. Upon assessment youth’s right hand was swollen
slightly. She was able to move it. No skin was broken, no
bruising or bleeding, youth was offered PRN but refused
and refused ice pack.”
• Vista Maria Nurse Note dated May 2, 2025, for Youth B
was reviewed. The nursing note reported Youth B reported
pain in her back and had a small nodule on her head.
Youth B was provided ice and ibuprofen.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, staff responded properly in the
altercation and provided appropriate medical attention to the
youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
